elements.description:
`api-request-panel`
An complete request editor and response view panels in single element

This element is to replace `api-console-request` element from `mulesoft/api-console`
project repository.

This is also a base case for any application that renders request and
response views.

It combines `api-request-editor` and `response-view` elements and
reacts on `api-request` and `api-response` events.
It also adds additional configuration options that exists in API console
(proxy, additional headers).

## `api-request` and `api-response` events

See full documentation here: https://github.com/advanced-rest-client/api-components-api/blob/master/docs/api-request-and-response.md

## Dependencies

- This components does not include any polyfills
- This component nor it's children does not contain trasnsport library.
Any transport library that handles ARC request event can work with this
component. See `advanced-rest-client/xhr-simple-request` for implementation
details
- From authorization panel changes:
 - `auth-settings-changed` custom event is stopped from bubbling. Listen for `authorization-settings-changed` event instead.
- From auth-method-oauth2 changes:
 - Added `deliveryMethod` and `deliveryName` properties to the `detail.setting` object.
- From auth-method-oauth1 changes:
 - Crypto library is no longer included into the element. Use `advanced-rest-client/cryptojs-lib` component to include the library if your project doesn't use crypto libraries already.

## Narrow view

Generally the API components are flexible and mobile friendly. However,
it is possible to set `narrow` property to render form elements in
a mobile fieldly view. In most cases it means that forms controls are
rendered in different layout.

## api-navigation integration

The element works with `api-navigation` element. Set `handle-navigation-events`
attribute when using `api-navigation` so the component will automatically
update selection when internal API navigation occurres.

properties.name: isPayload
properties.description:
Set to true when the request can carry a payload.
It's required for calculating headers errors.

properties.name: scrollTarget
properties.description: Main scroll target for the app.

properties.name: _shouldHaveListener
properties.description: True if the event listener should be installed.

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: aware
properties.description: `raml-aware` scope property to use.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: AMF HTTP method (operation in AMF vocabulary) ID.

properties.name: handleNavigationEvents
properties.description:
By default application hosting the element must set `selected`
property. When using `api-navigation` element
by setting this property the element listens for navigation events
and updates the state

properties.name: amfModel
properties.description:
A model's `@id` of selected documentation part.
Special case is for `summary` view. It's not part of an API
but most applications has some kind of summary view for the
API.

properties.name: noUrlEditor
properties.description:
Hides the URL editor from the view.
The editor is still in the DOM and the `urlInvalid` property still will be set.

properties.name: baseUri
properties.description:
A base URI for the API. To be set if RAML spec is missing `baseUri`
declaration and this produces invalid URL input. This information
is passed to the URL editor that prefixes the URL with `baseUri` value
if passed URL is a relative URL.

properties.name: redirectUri
properties.description:
OAuth2 redirect URI.
This value **must** be set in order for OAuth 1/2 to work properly.

properties.name: narrow
properties.description: If set it will renders the view in the narrow layout.

properties.name: request
properties.description: Created by the transport ARFC `request` object

properties.name: response
properties.description: Created by the transport ARC `response` object.

properties.name: hasResponse
properties.description: Computed value, true, when the response object is set.

properties.name: isErrorResponse
properties.description: A flag indincating request error.

properties.name: responseIsXhr
properties.description: True if the response is made by the Fetch / XHR api.

properties.name: responseError
properties.description: An error object associated with the response when error.

properties.name: loadingTime
properties.description:
Response full loading time. This information is received from the
transport library.

properties.name: timing
properties.description:
If the transport method is able to collect detailed information about request timings
then this value will be set. It's the `timings` property from the HAR 1.2 spec.

properties.name: redirectsTiming
properties.description:
If the transport method is able to collect detailed information about redirects timings
then this value will be set. It's a list of `timings` property from the HAR 1.2 spec.

properties.name: redirects
properties.description: It will be set if the transport method can generate information about redirections.

properties.name: sourceMessage
properties.description:
Http message sent to the server.

This information should be available only in case of advanced HTTP transport.

properties.name: appendHeaders
properties.description:
Forces the console to send headers defined in this string overriding any used defined
header.
This should be an array of headers with `name` and `value` keys, e.g.:
```
[{
  name: "x-token",
  value: "value"
}]
```

properties.name: proxy
properties.description:
If set every request made from the console will be proxied by the service provided in this
value.
It will prefix entered URL with the proxy value. so the call to
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/path/http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value`

If the proxy require a to pass the URL as a query parameter define value as follows:
`https://proxy.com/path/?url=`. In this case be sure to set `proxy-encode-url`
attribute.

properties.name: proxyEncodeUrl
properties.description:
If `proxy` is set, it will URL encode the request URL before appending it to the proxy URL.
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdomain.com%2Fpath%2F%3Fquery%3Dsome%2Bvalue`

properties.name: bowerLocation
properties.description:
Location of the `bower_components` folder.
It should be a path from server's root path including bower_components.

methods.name: filterHeaders
methods.description:
Filter array of headers and return not duplicated array of the same headers.
Duplicated headers should be appended to already found one using coma separator.

params.name: headers
params.description:
Headers array to filter. All objects in headers array must have "name"
               and "value" keys.

methods.name: headersToString
methods.description: Parse headers array to Raw HTTP headers string.

params.name: headersArray
params.description:
List of objects with "name" and "value"
properties.

return.desc: A HTTP representation of the headers.

methods.name: headerItemToString
methods.description:
Transforms a header model item to a string.
Array values are supported.

methods.name: headersToJSON
methods.description:
Parse HTTP headers input from string to array of objects containing `name` and `value`
properties.

params.name: headers
params.description: Raw HTTP headers input or Headers object

return.desc:
The array of objects where properties are `name` as a header
name and `value` as a header content.

methods.name: _headersStringToJSON
methods.description:
Parse headers string to array of objects.
See `#toJSON` for more info.

methods.name: _hedersToJSON
methods.description:
Parse Headers object to array of objects.
See `#toJSON` for more info.

methods.name: _oldCombine
methods.description:
Helper method for old system: combine headers list with encoding value.
Note that this function will update the original array.

params.name: encoding
params.description: An encoding string from the old request.

return.desc: True if encoding has been added to the array.

methods.name: getContentType
methods.description: Get the Content-Type value from the headers.

params.name: headers
params.description: Either HTTP headers string or list of headers.

return.desc: A content-type header value or null if not found

methods.name: replaceHeaderValue
methods.description: Replace value for given header in the headers list.

params.name: headers
params.description:
A headers object. Can be string, array of objects or
Headers object.

methods.name: getHeaderError
methods.description: Get error message for given header string.

return.desc: An error message or null if the headers are valid.

methods.name: _scrollHandler
methods.description: Runs on every scroll event. Consumer of this behavior may override this method.

methods.name: _defaultScrollTarget
methods.description:
The default scroll target. Consumers of this behavior may want to customize
the default scroll target.

methods.name: _doc
methods.description: Shortcut for the document element

methods.name: _scrollTop
methods.description: Sets the number of pixels that the content of an element is scrolled upward.

methods.name: _scrollLeft
methods.description: Sets the number of pixels that the content of an element is scrolled to the left.

methods.name: scroll
methods.description: Scrolls the content to a particular place.

methods.name: _scrollTargetWidth
methods.description: Gets the width of the scroll target.

methods.name: _scrollTargetHeight
methods.description: Gets the height of the scroll target.

methods.name: _isValidScrollTarget
methods.description: Returns true if the scroll target is a valid HTMLElement.

methods.name: toggleScrollListener
methods.description: Enables or disables the scroll event listener.

params.name: yes
params.description: True to add the event, False to remove it.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: _registerNavigationEvents
methods.description:
Registers `api-navigation-selection-changed` event listener handler
on window object.

methods.name: _unregisterNavigationEvents
methods.description:
Removes event listener from window object for
`api-navigation-selection-changed` event.

methods.name: _handleNavChanged
methods.description: Registers / unregisters event listeners depending on `state`

methods.name: _navigationHandler
methods.description: Handler for `api-navigation-selection-changed` event.

methods.name: _updateRedirectUri
methods.description: Sets OAuth 2 redirect URL for the authorization panel

methods.name: _computeHasResponse
methods.description: Computes if there is a reponse object.

methods.name: _apiRequestHandler
methods.description:
A handler for the API call.
This handler will only check if there is authorization required
and if the user is authorizaed.

methods.name: _appendConsoleHeaders
methods.description: Appends headers defined in the `appendHeaders` array.

methods.name: _appendProxy
methods.description: Sets the proxy URL if the `proxy` property is set.

methods.name: _apiResponseHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the `api-response` custom event. Sets values on the response
panel when response is ready.

methods.name: _propagateResponse
methods.description: Propagate `api-response` detail object.

elements.name: ApiElements.ApiRequestPanel
